abstract: Psychiatrist Dr Jonathan Woodcock testifies as witness for defense in case against James E Holmes, man accused of 2012 shooting rampage in Colorado movie theater; states Holmes suffers from psychotic mental illness of which shooting was a manifestation; defense has argued Holmes was legally insane at time of shooting.
lead_paragraph: A psychiatrist who examined James E. Holmes after his shooting rampage in a Colorado movie theater said that Mr. Holmes did not have the capacity to distinguish right from wrong.

headline.main: Defense Tries to Put Focus on Sanity of Aurora Gunman
headline.print_headline: Defense Tries to Put Focus on Sanity of Gunman

snippet: A psychiatrist who examined James E. Holmes after his shooting rampage in a Colorado movie theater said that Mr. Holmes did not have the capacity to distinguish right from wrong.
